answers.answer: Hello and welcome to the community.I would suggest that you see an allergist.  They are specially trained to help people with these types of problems.Also, this might be a great question for the live chat MedHelp is having on Monday.  The information is pinned to the top of the board, and I will also private message you the information.Thanks for the great question.Please keep us updated on what you learn.Take care and have a blessed day.

question: I have a lot of problems with meds for my diabetes so switched to insulin five years ago. Recently, I started getting hives every time I inject. My doctor says its a sensitivity, not an allergy, but whatever, it's driving me bonkers. I started on Lantus, once daily, and also very low carbs to avoid having to top up with rapid insulin. That worked for awhile. Now, I am itching day and night but especially after taking my Lantus, at midnight. Lately, I've started waking up (about 2 hours after going to sleep) with severe nervousness (hysterics, almost) and have to get up to try to calm down. Antihistamines helped at first but not so much recently. As a result, I am getting very little sleep and am nearly exhausted both physically and mentally.My doctor seems to be at a loss so any suggestions appreciated.
title: Anybody else allergic to insulin?
